headline: Will Ohio Redistricting Commission's new approach yield better results? Optimism varies
author: Jessie Balmert
sentences: Seeking fresh eyes and perspectives, the commission hired two new mapmakers: Michael McDonald, a University of Florida political science professor, and Douglas Johnson, president of the National Demographics Corp. "I remain skeptical that this is going to yield a workable result, but it's the best possibility that we could get that done," Ohio Secretary of State Frank LaRose said of hiring the new consultants to work with currently employed mapmakers.

It's a tack that advocates of redistricting reform had begged them to consider months ago: draw lines in public rather than behind closed doors and use mapmakers who answer to the entire commission rather than legislative leaders alone.
